sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>scooter</radical> sits at the entrance where people <radical>enter</radical>. You jump on and are flung inside! Because a lot of other people did the same thing, it's really <kanji>crowded</kanji> in here.
meaningInfo: Imagine going to your favorite store. There's a scooter on and waiting at the entrance. You can't see inside, so when you are scooted inside by the scooter, you just get thrown into a packed room. So many other people on scooters! It's too crowded!
readingMnemonic: Whoever came up with the scooter entrance idea, that made your favorite store so <kanji>crowded</kanji>? Only a <ja><reading>子</reading></ja> (<ja>こ</ja>) could come up with something like this. They don't really think about the dangers and legal implications of using a scooter to launch people into a crowded space.
readingInfo: Imagine a <ja>子</ja> at the head of a huge conference table. "I know how to make our stores crowded again!" they shout before showing everyone their plan drawn in Crayons.
